result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Gaffney II

defendant.name: Gaffney, Richard A, II
defendant.address: 132 E Richards Rd Apt 4, Oregon, WI 53575

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; exhibits #1 thru 4 marked; State's witness called, sworn & testified; direct exam by ADA Barnett;exhibits #1 thru 4 offered & received; cross exam by Atty Dutch; exhibit #5 marked; Ct questioned witness; witness excused; State rests; no more witnesses; argument by ADA Barnett; argument by Atty Dutch; rebuttal by ADA Barnett; Ct rules that defn is competent; Ct adjourned.
from counsel reqeusting CH be rescheduled. granted.
-2nd Order for competency examination by DHS. (actually sent out 10/16/14)

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; re: Dr Brad Smith's report; ADA Barnett notes that doctor wants in patient eval; Atty Dutch affirms the report; ADA Barnett offers that DHS should submit notification to court for continued care and not require in patient treatment; Ct so orders;Ct adjourned.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; Ct notes receipt of report, ADA hasn't reviewed the report and requests a continuance; Atty Dutch offers that he has received the report and reviewed it with his client but does agree to continuance; Ct sets CH; Ct adjourned.
for competency examination by Department of Health Services
Parties have agreement.  Ct has colloque with defn.  Judge orders compentcy order
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Barnett
Info filed, copy given defn, reading waived, defn enters plea of NG, motns due 20 days, bail continued.

No promises at this time per Atty Dutch.  Defn had head injury a number of years ago, but Atty Dutch is confident defn knows what he is coing.  STate's disc motion filed.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed.  Defn advised of right to and waived PH.  Court accepted waiver of PH.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant in court with Attorney Gregory N Dutch.  Emily Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with anyone employed at Stark Automotive
- Defendant shall not be at or around any Stark Automotive locations
- Defendant shall not use or possess any financial instruments that are not in your name
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
